intro: Monticalia novolanata, commonly known as the white-flowered monticalia, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments within the understory of tropical forests. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
